entries.meaning: (genetics) Involving crosses between several or all possible combinations.
(obsolete) Of lines: Meeting and intersecting; not parallel.
examples: […]  connecting diallel lines which provide not only particle flow between the bodies, but also the flow of photon and gravitational information as well  […]

entries.meaning: A set of all possible pairs of items from a specified set of items, especially when used for a study of diallel crosses.

A form of logical fallacy in which a proposition that is required to prove another proposition can only be proved by means of assuming the truth of the proposition one is trying to prove; circular reasoning.
